definition: Thaksin Shinawatra (1949-), Thai businessman and politician, prime minister 2001-2006
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Thaksin and his wife, Pojaman, were in Beijing until Sunday for the opening of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫婦在北京參加奧運開幕式，一直逗留到星期天。

sentences.english: He was ousted in a coup two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他信兩年前在一次政變中被罷免。

sentences.english: The king accepted the coup that overthrew Mr Thaksin in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 國王認可了2006年推翻他信的那場政變。

sentences.english: 'Thaksin called me to congratulate and encourage me, ' she said. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 她說，他信打電話給我，向我表示祝賀並提出了鼓勵。

sentences.english: Supporters of former Prime Minister Thaksin breached the security cordons around the summit site.
sentences.chinese: 前總理他信的支持者突破了峯會會場周圍的警方防線。

sentences.english: Mrs. Pojaman was convicted last month of tax evasion and released on bail.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫人上個月被認定犯有逃稅罪，交保候審。

sentences.english: In using such class-war rhetoric, Mr Thaksin is playing with fire.
sentences.chinese: 使用這種階級對抗的言辭，他信是在玩火。

sentences.english: Thai courts charged Thaksin in absentia for his role in fomenting the protests.
sentences.chinese: 泰國法庭缺席指控他信煽動了抗議。
他信從政之前曾是位電信大亨。

sentences.english: So would she handle the power with and without her brother [Thaksin].
sentences.chinese: 她掌權之際，會不會有她哥哥他信的身影？

sentences.english: But the generals will surely do their damnedest to thwart a Thaksinite restoration.
sentences.chinese: 但將軍們一定會盡他們最大的努力來阻止他信的復辟。

sentences.english: There was a darker side to the Taksin government.
UDD sources told VOA, Mr. Thaksin backs the reconciliation plan.
sentences.chinese: UDD告訴VOA，他信已經回到和談計劃中。

sentences.english: 61-year-old Somchai is the brother-in-law of the ousted Thaksin Shinwatra.
sentences.chinese: 現年61歲的頌猜是前總理他信的妹夫。

sentences.english: But the red-shirt movement, for all that it remains inchoate, has outgrown Mr Thaksin.
sentences.chinese: 儘管紅衫軍仍羽翼未豐，其目標已不止於尋回他信。

sentences.english: Mr Thaksin's wealth has been impounded.
sentences.chinese: 他信的財富已經被沒收了。

definition: religious belief/to practice a faith/to be religious
Hun Sen (1952-), prime minister of Cambodia since 1985
Basuki Tjahaja Purnama (1966-), Indonesian politician, governor of Jakarta (2014-)
to swear to God/to cross one's heart
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
